name: 2.03. Injury and Death
content:
@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.OiNttXSDW598DIEs]{(Index) Combat Rules}

@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.UEmSoktVjUEI46C2]{2.03. Injury and Death}

  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.Z0gVQW6Hx4Hb4zps]{2.03.1. Loss of Hit Points}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.PN9yC36RUizvrAUk]{2.03.2. Disabled (0 Hit Points)}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.MgPati0XYUli8q2G]{2.03.3. Dying (Negative Hit Points)}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.ZKXUIJptoysFa5JI]{2.03.4. Dead}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.nEPpg39gAOwIxDki]{2.03.5. Stable Characters and Recovery}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.JWPzEMuF9fPOLqCF]{2.03.6. Healing}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.oyi4ByFG6yVswC0m]{2.03.7. Temporary Hit Points}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.Hzi8GbT19bP7mdSP]{2.03.8. Nonlethal Damage}

Source PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 189

Your hit points measure how hard you are to kill. No matter how many hit points you lose, your character isn’t hindered in any way until your hit points drop to 0 or lower.
